ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1 hour
5 hours per week
10 hours per week
4 hours per week
I spent 4 hours per week.
2 hours
3 h

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It was a good course. Due to the number of MD students in the course, the topic often shifted to a very medical discussion, which made it hard to follow sometimes.
A good overview of worker health problems, and in dealing with environmental concerns in health.

Strengths:focus on cardio-respiratory issues with occupational and environmental medicineWeaknesses:Early morning class, really early before children's day care start, not tailored for parents.Different presenters though bought in different perspectives, limited instructor interaction and caused vague discussions at times.No information on the finals in terms of previous years exams posted to provide an overview of the format.
Ok. A grading rubric should be provided for the midterm exam.

This course is an introduction to environmental and occupational medicine. I think it is well-taught and designed, and covers the basic aspects of this field. I appreciated lectures from non-physicians such as industrial engineers, because as a physician we are not trained to think like they do and it was interesting to hear their approach.
Strength: Guest lectures made the class more interesting and informativeWeakness: Could use more guidance on mid-term and final studying.

Very interesting. Mostly guest speakers. I really got to see the breadth of Environmental and Occupational health. I didn't think it extended to zoonotic diseases or to Health Impact Assessments. I felt like I learned a lot from very informative and interactive lectures, and I didn't have to do very much work--just a few readings and a midterm and final. With that combination, I'd say this course is ideal for busy students.
Good course, especially for people without medical background. Medical professionals may find it a bit redundant. Would like to see more material on environmental impact.
I think the lectures were excellent.

Interesting topic each week. Some lecturers focused a lot on medicine, which became hard for non-physician. The content for each week does not overlap and to me connects poorly. Hence no re-enforcement of knowledge until final exam.
Interesting discussion and a diverse class.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Meredith Stowe  She was a great instructor. When she taught everything was straight forward and easy to understand.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Very good.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Consideratewas present at all lectures and hence was a primary contact point
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Ok

Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Meredith is a very kind professor who cares very much about her students. She was very responsive to our feedback and to our concerns. She gave good lectures and wanted to make sure that students were grasping the essential concepts, which was appreciated.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Meredith is great. Very responsive to students, and always willing to help. She take pride in her classes, and she gives good feedback.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Greatly appreciated her passion for the subject.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Great job! Thanks for the course and very nice of you to host a gathering for the students in your home.

Instructor: Meredith Stowe  She is the most sweet professor and very understanding. She is provided me with good feedback on professional development. I was very impress with her friendliness and willingness to get involve with the students.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Clear, helpful
Instructor: Oyebode Taiwo  He was a great instructor. When he taught he gave lots of examples to support his concepts and everything was easy to understand.
Instructor: Oyebode Taiwo  Very good.
Instructor: Oyebode Taiwo  Limited interaction
Instructor: Oyebode Taiwo  Ok
Instructor: Oyebode Taiwo  Dr. Taiwo was a very good lecturer. His lectures generated interesting discussions and he was very good at moderating these.
Instructor: Oyebode Taiwo  I didn't get to see Bode too much. He lectured a few times, but I can't say I got to know anything about him or his teaching style.
Instructor: Oyebode Taiwo  Very good, knowledgeable about the subject.
Instructor: Oyebode Taiwo  Great job! Thanks for the course.
Instructor: Oyebode Taiwo  He was amanzing. He provided us with wonderful lectures.
Instructor: Oyebode Taiwo  Clear, patient, encouraging

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course was a great course. It was an opportunity to learn about environmental health in a different way that is applicable to people's everydaylives. It was nice to have different topics every week and to hear from different people.
The course is an extremely broad overview. Vague at times
Ok

This is a good introduction to environmental and occupational medicine. The course does not require too much work and is interesting. I feel that, as a physician, I had somewhat of an advantage in this course just because many of the lectures were about specific organ damage that can be caused by toxins, and I wonder what this course was like for non physicians. Anyway, I would recommend this course.
Good course. Lots of practical applications. Would recommend because work load appropriate and interesting topics

Yes, if you're a busy student who wants to learn but doesn't have time to do a lot of work, this class is great. Most of the learning comes from in-class lectures and discussions and not so much from outside readings. Warning: the class is at 8am. It's very early, and Meredith does not like it when you're late. So if you can't get up that early, don't take this class.
Good introductory course for non-medical background students
I enjoy this class. It helped me to have an understanding of the risk at work and in the environment.
Yes, I would recommend this course for a fellow student. It is a great course because it gives you a comprehensive view of the occupational medicine field.
An easy and very interesting class, enjoyed all the lectures and the discussions.
